Tab.label: Bridging Simulation
select.label: Dropdown Label1
Request.Name: Bridging analysis: plot of ORR (CDx+) and sensitivity
Title: Bridging analysis:HHH:plot of ORR and sensitivity
PlotCode:
est1 <- est_ORR(m1=round(as.numeric(input$text)), m=round(as.numeric(input$text3)), n11=input$slide2, n1=input$slide, n01=input$slide4, n0=input$slide3,
                  orr=as.numeric(input$text4), c=input$slide5)
  effA <- est1$eff1
  tprA <- est1$tpr1    
  plot_dp(tpr0=tprA, eff0=effA, ylim0=input$text5 )
  abline(h=as.numeric(input$text4)*(input$slide2/input$slide)+as.numeric(input$text6)*(1-input$slide2/input$slide), lty=3, col='blue')
FootCode:
paste0( "The blue horizontal reference line is the ORR in the population of CDA+ and CDx+\n",
"Pr(CTA+)=m1/m=",  round(as.numeric(input$text)/as.numeric(input$text3), 3),
";   Pr(CDx+|CTA+)=n11/n1=", round(input$slide2/input$slide, 3), 
";   Pr(CDx+|CTA-)=n01/n0=", round(input$slide4/input$slide3, 3), 
"\nest1 <- est_ORR(m1=", round(as.numeric(input$text)), ", m=", round(as.numeric(input$text3)), 
", n11=", input$slide2, ", n1=", input$slide, ", n01=", input$slide4, ", n0=", input$slide3,
                 ",  orr=", as.numeric(input$text4), ", c=", input$slide5, ")\n", 
"  effA <- est1$eff1 \n",
"  tprA <- est1$tpr1   \n",
"  plot_dp(tpr0=tprA, eff0=effA, ylim0=c(", input$text5, ") )",
"\n\n#Reference: http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/10543406.2014.920340"
)
uilab4: number of CTA+ patients enrolled in bridging (concordance) study
uilab5: number of CTA+ and CDx+ out of n1
uilab6: number of CTA- patients enrolled in bridging (concordance) study
uilab7: number of CTA- and CDx+ out of n0
uilab8: single-arm objective response rate in subgroup CTA+ and CDx+
uilab9: proportion of delta2/delta1, where delta2 is efficacy in CTA- and CDx+
uilab11: single-arm objective response rate in subgroup CTA+ and CDx-
radio.label: NA
text.label: 1. m1: Number of enrolled CTA+
text.label3: 3. m: the total number of screened patients with valid CTA results (eligible for bridging study)
text.label4: 8. orr: single-arm objective response rate in subgroup CTA+ and CDx+
text.label6: 11: single-arm objective response rate in subgroup CTA+ and CDx-
text.label8: 11: single-arm objective response rate in subgroup CTA+ and CDx-
text.label9: 11: single-arm objective response rate in subgroup CTA+ and CDx-
text.label10: 11: single-arm objective response rate in subgroup CTA+ and CDx-
slide.label: 4. n1: Number of CTA+ patients enrolled in bridging (concordance) study
slide.label2: 5. n11: Number of CTA+ and CDx+ out of n1
slide.label3: 6. n0: number of CTA- patients enrolled in bridging (concordance) study
slide.label4: 7. n01: number of CTA- and CDx+ out of n0
slide.label5: 9. c: proportion of delta2/delta1, where delta2 is efficacy in CTA- and CDx+

Tab.label: BDT
select.label: Dropdown Label1
Request.Name: iBDT CSF simulation
Title: Simulation of iBDT Critical Success Factor (CSF) analysis
PlotCode:
iBDT_CSF(
     levInt=input$text, #set cohort lables to compare, '::' defines levels
      n1c=input$text2,  #fixed a samples for other parameter change
      orr0=input$text3, #ORRs of controls match to lev1
      delta.r=input$text4,  #fixed an improved ORR effect size
      delta.t=input$text5, #fixed TTE effect size month
      mt0=input$text6, #tte values of control or benchmarks
      cv=input$text7, #coefficient variation for tte
      cutoff=input$text8, #decision threshold over ORR or delta ORR
      nsel=input$text9,#simulate different samples
      dorr=input$text10, #simulate different ORR effect size
      dtte=input$text11, #simulate different TTE effect size
      dr1r=input$text12, #simulate decision threshold
      yellowC=input$text13, #yellow range for ORR decision thresholds
      showAll=!as.logical(input$radio) 
    )
radio.label: 0. show iBDT go risk only
text.label: 1. cohort labels seprated by ','
text.label10: 10. different ORR effect size for simulation
text.label11: 11. different TTE effect size for simulation
text.label13: 13. yellow range for ORR decision thresholds
slide.label: NA

Tab.label: BDT
select.label: Dropdown Label1
Request.Name: Integrated Bayesian Decision Theoretic (BDT) Analysis
Title: Integrated Bayesian Decision Theoretic (BDT) Analysis
PlotCode:
DT_tab <<- BDT_UaL.diff( 
  levVars=input$text, 
  dr_lev=input$text2, 
   incidence=input$text3,
   numRsp=input$text4,  
   n_ij=input$text5,   
   dr_th=input$text6, 
   muTTE=input$text7,
  sdTTE=input$text8,
  showBar=TRUE,  
    th.arrow= 0.8,      
    payoff= input$text9
)
FootCode:
Longer blue and green bars as well as shorter red bars give a better intuitive metrics. 
The blue bar visualizes the utility based ORR and the green bar is based on the continues variable such as TTE. The red bar visualizes the Bayes decision loss. It is better to select the cohort with longer blue or green bars and the decision rule with shorter red bars.
Get tumor/biomarker incidence number from https://seer.cancer.gov/explorer/application.php, which is the incidence per 100000 people. So, please devide the number by 1000. The final rate is  the number of people having the cancer in every 100 people.
Or, download the estimates in Unitied States in 2017 (https://www.cancer.org/content/dam/cancer-org/research/cancer-facts-and-statistics/annual-cancer-facts-and-figures/2017/cancer-facts-and-figures-2017.pdf).
uilab7: 7. Expectation of the continues variable, i.e. TTE.
uilab8: 8. Standard deviation of the continues variable, i.e. TTE
radio.label: NA
text.label: 1. Define BDT framework
text.label4: 4. Number or ratio of responders, "0.3vs0.2" is treatment vs reference.
text.label6: 6. Decision threshold, eg."0.1::0.3,0.5::0.55,0.6::0.7" are the two thresholds for each of the 3 cohorts
text.label7: 7. Expectation of the continues variable, i.e. TTE
text.label8: 8. Standard deviation of the continues variable
slide.label: NA

Tab.label: BDT

Request.Name: Bayesian Decision Theoretic (BDT) Analysis
Title: BDT framework with CSF to evaluate the trial plan
PlotCode:
DT_tab <<- BDT_UaL( 
  levVars=input$text, 
  dr_lev=input$text2, 
   incidence=input$text3,
   pBprior=input$text4,  
   n_ij=input$text5,   
   dr_th=input$text6, 
   drFunc=eval(parse(text=input$text7)),  #my.eLoss
  showBar=TRUE,  
    th.arrow= 0.8,      
    payoff= input$text8
)
FootCode:
The blue bar visualizes the utility. The red bar visualizes the Bayes decision loss.
Get tumor/biomarker incidence number from https://seer.cancer.gov/explorer/application.php, which is the incidence per 100000 people. So, please devide the number by 1000. The final rate is  the number of people having the cancer in every 100 people.
Or, download the estimates in Unitied States in 2017 (https://www.cancer.org/content/dam/cancer-org/research/cancer-facts-and-statistics/annual-cancer-facts-and-figures/2017/cancer-facts-and-figures-2017.pdf).

text.label: 1. Define BDT framework
text.label7: 7. A R function for Bayes decision loss

Tab.label: BDT
select.label: Dropdown Label1
Request.Name: Bayesian decision-theoretic trees
Title: Basic BDT frame for trial plan evaluation
PlotCode:
DT_tab <<- DT_frame( 
  blBMK=input$text,          #Baseline Biomarkers, required input
  tumorType=input$text2, #Types of tumors, required input
  dose=input$text3,             #numeric values of dose levels, required input  
  prior_ti=input$text4,        #PrioInfo Tumor Incidence: 
                               #length is length(blBMK)*length(tumorType)
                               #values obtained from prior knowledge
  prior_prop=input$text5,      #proportion of patients in the subgroup of dose and bmk
                               #length is either length(dose) or length(dose)*length(blBMK)*length(tumorType)
                               #values obtained from prior knowledge
  prob_stop0 = input$text6,  #Prob(not stop|dose) matching to the levels in dose
                               #length is length(dose)
                               #the proportions obtained from early phase trials
  prob_BR1   = input$text7,   #Prob(BioResp=1|stop=0, dose, tumor, bmk), 
                               #length is either length(dose) or length(dose)*length(blBMK)*length(tumorType)
                               #values obtained from early phase trials  
  prob_CB1_BR = input$text8,   #Prob(ClinBenefit=1|BioResp=1) and Prob(CB=1|BR=0)
  showTree   = TRUE,           #if FASLE only return the tree table
  showProb   = TRUE,           #if TRUE show the probablities on the tree and return the probability table
  showBar    = TRUE,          #show the barplot of expected U(dose|{T,B})
  
  #other args for plotting
  th.arrow        = 0.8,       #horizontal space between an arrow and the the target
  th.utDB    = 1,            #vertical space between dose sign and the utility values
  topRatio   = input$text9,            #the top ratio of joint p-values (or utilities) that need to be colored
  topCol     = 'red' ,          #the color for the top joint p-values  
  payoff    =input$text10   #payoff values for CB=1 and CB=0
)
FootCode:
U(d,T,B) is the expected utility of the action {choosing a dose level, in a biomarker-identified subpopulation of a tumor type }. 
Get tumor incidence number from https://seer.cancer.gov/explorer/application.php, which is the incidence per 100000 people. So, please devide the number by 1000. The final rate is  the number of people having the cancer in every 100 people.
Or, download the estimates in Unitied States in 2017 (https://www.cancer.org/content/dam/cancer-org/research/cancer-facts-and-statistics/annual-cancer-facts-and-figures/2017/cancer-facts-and-figures-2017.pdf).
uilab5: 5. Proportion of patients among the subgroups of different doses
uilab6: 6. Prob(stop=0|dose): probability of not stopping due to toxcitiy.
uilab9: 9. The top ratio of outcomes to be colored in red
radio.label: NA
text.label: 1. Baseline Biomarkers
text.label4: 4. Tumor Incidence mapping to the 3rd column (B) or the 2nd level nodes in the tree
text.label5: 5. Proportion of patients among the subgroups of doses (maping to 4.)
text.label9: 9. The top ratio of outcomes to be colored in red
slide.label: NA

Tab.label: SubgPwrCal

Request.Name: Power Calculator
Title: Power analysis for two-group comparison test
PlotCode:
BEACH_PowerPlot(n.rg=input$text,
                  n.vl=input$slide, 
                  theta.rg=input$text2,
                  theta.vl=input$slide2, 
                  sgm.rg=input$text3, 
                  sgm.vl=input$slide3, 
                  muA=as.numeric(input$text4), 
                  prev=input$text5, 
                  alpha=input$slide4, 
                  simSize=as.numeric(input$text6),
                  m1=round(as.numeric(input$text7)),
                  r1=input$text8
)
uilab3: 3. Range of difference between two group means
uilab8: 8. Range of the prevalence for the lower-mean group
uilab11: 11. proportions in the groups with higher means

Tab.label: NZI_Bayesian
select.label: Dropdown Label1
Request.Name: Near-Zero-Informed Bayesian method for drug-toxicity stopping rule analysis
Title: Near-Zero-Informed Bayesian method for drug-toxicity stopping rule analysis
PlotCode:
rsk.tb1<<- 
    nzib(stopAt=input$text,
         N1=input$text2,         #max number of samples
       maxIDR=input$text3, #max expected acceptable occurrence rate
       plot.type=as.numeric(substring(input$radio2, 1, 1)), #plot type 1,2,3,4
       normIDR=input$text4,  #normal occurrence rate, default maxIDR/2 
       bay.prior=input$text5, #hyper parameter in beta-binomial
       rsk.xlim=input$text6,    #x-axis range for risk plot
       rsk.ylim=input$text7,    #y-axis range for risk plot
       errI.xlim=input$text8,  #x-axis range for type I error plot
       plot4=as.logical(input$radio), 
       B1=input$text9,
       goTh=input$text10
  )
uilab1: 1. stoping rule threshold for number of Idiosyncratic Adverse Drug Reaction (IADR)
uilab3: 3. max expected acceptable occurence rate of IADR
uilab4: 4. expected occurence rate of IADR considered as normal
uilab8: 8. X-axis range in type I error plot and Superiority plot
radio.label: 9. Show plot D-F
radio.choice2: c('1. NZI Bayesian', '2. NZI Bayesian and Binomial', '3. NZI Bayesian and another Bayesian', '4. show all the 3 lines')
text.label: 1. stopping threshold for number of Idiosyncratic Adverse Drug Reaction (#IADR)
text.label3: 3. max expected acceptable occurence rate of IADR (default is 1/n)
text.label4: 4. expected occurence rate of IADR considered as normal, only useful for frequentist Binomial
text.label5: 5. Hyper parameters in Beta distribution for traditional Bayesian
text.label8: 8. X-axis range in type I error plot and Superiority plot
text.label10: 11. Thresholds for go/no-go "type I error, type II error"
slide.label: NA

Tab.label: NZI_Bayesian

Request.Name: Distribution plots
Title: Distribution plots
PlotCode:
bbin(
    prior.a=input$text, #1. parameters in p~Beta(a=, b=) prior distribution
    prior.b=input$text2, #2. parameters in p~Beta(a=, b=) prior distribution
    N1=input$text3,            #3. planned sample size
    pa=input$text4,           #4. expected average for event rate p
    p.xL=input$text5,        #5. xlim for beta distribution
    x.xL=input$text6         #6. xlim for beta-binomial distribution
  )
